noun.description: The action of entering or gaining access to an organization or place surreptitiously, especially in order to acquire secret information or cause damage.
examples: the army fenced parts of the border in an effort to stop militant infiltration

noun.description: Permeation of a liquid into something by filtration.
examples: improved water infiltration into the soil
this mosaic was in danger of being lost because of the infiltration of rainwater

noun.description: The process of gradually permeating or becoming a part of something.
examples: the gradual infiltration of Boyce's music into the national consciousness
